The Dakota Valley School Board will host a public forum Thursday night, Sept. 10th,, at 7:00 pm in the HS Gym for the purpose of receiving feedback in regards to the start of the 2020-21 school year. The Board is providing this forum as an avenue for the Board to receive information and will not have general business items to act upon as they would in a general board meeting.

Per Board Policy, speakers are limited to 5 minutes. Those wishing to address the Board please fill out the sign up form at
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oFD9FdX9TQL-uklKLAS2ekiU3BZlf62a/view?usp=sharing and deliver to Dr. Rasmussen (email to jerry.rasmussen@k12.sd.us or drop off at the DV Administrative Offices) prior to the meeting. Mr. Kistner, DV Board President, will recognize speakers who will then move to the podium to introduce themselves. If possible, speakers on the same topic are requested to select a spokesperson for that topic.

The gym was selected to ensure room for social distancing for attendees. Masks are also required for attendance.

post_text: Congratulations to DV students Gunnar, Caden, and Kobby, members of the North Sioux City Robotics Club. The North Sioux City RoboKodas Robotics Club's 77000X competed at the 2nd Annual Canton VEX Robotics Tournament in Canton and finished as the Tournament Champions and Robot Skills Champion. The RoboKodas' robot named "Atta Baby", is ranked first in Robot Skills in the state of South Dakota. The RoboKodas also earned the Excellence Award which is the highest award presented in the VEX Robotics competition. This award is presented to a team that exemplifies overall excellence in building a high-quality robotics program. The recipient is a strong contender in numerous award categories, including: engineering notebook, design, robot performance, Robot Skills, quality of the team‚Äôs interview with judges, building a high-quality robotics program, and team conduct and sportsmanship. The RoboKodas will be competing at the South Dakota VEX State Tournament in February and traveling to the Create U.S. Open in April.
